attributes.action: Reduce tuition fees for students who face mostly online lectures for 2020-2021
attributes.additional_details:
Paying £9250 a year for learning online, which can be done at much better value using independent resources, is unfair on students who don’t see the extortionate tuition fees justifying the benefits of university 
 Many students are reporting that their experience of online lectures so far isn’t fulfilling their expectation for university standards. The lack of a lecture structured day means less efficient studying and threatens them progressing as expected on their course.
attributes.background: The government should pressure universities to reduce tuition fees for students who face having to learn via online lectures

rejection.details:
The fees universities charge are a matter for individual universities, and not the Government or House of Commons.

If your university course is affected by coronavirus in the next academic year, you could start a petition calling on the Government to reimburse all or part of your tuition fees.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
